channel.title: Casting :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: You have probably used casting to convert numeric values from one type to another, i.e.: int a = 5; double b = a;And int c = (int)b;What you are actually doing when you cast is transforming a value from one type to another. In the first case, you are taking the value of a (5), and converting it to the equivalent double (5.0). If you consider the internal representation of an integer (a 2â€™s complement binary number) to a double (an IEEE 754 standard representation), we are actually applying a conversion algorithm to the binary representations.
